answers.answer: I was diagnosed but don't have to take insulin...sorry! I will say I cried for hours after finding out and at the time I was 9 weeks. It is hard to hear that you have it but I would wonder if you can get yourself off the insulin at some point? If you change your diet and exercise routine, is it possible to come off the shots? I would ask your dr. It was the scariest thing I heard at the time of diagnosis but how I am 34 weeks and although it stinks to have it, I have gotten used to it and I have ended up having a very healthy pregnancy other than the GD! I hope all goes well! Just remember it should go away and the diet/exercise/shots are for your health and for your baby's health!!!! Cry but try not to dwell you can do it!!!!

I have the same you don't have to stick yourself in the belly I don't I stick myself in the outer thigh I know it sounds bad but along with diet and checking your sugar 4 times a day you will be fine im 36 weeks and I have made it this far and know you will too

I was diagnosed at 8 weeks because of my medical history and my miscarriage last December. I have insulin at night and at dinner. Just today I was told I have to start at lunch too. It is unpleasant but I think about my baby well being and it motivate me. Right diet, 3 meals and 3-4 snacks, a 15 min walk after meal and I can keep my increased of insulin to minimum. Just know that well control blood sugar is key to have a normal and healthy pregnancy. Don't hesitate to ask help to health practionners.

Thanks for the info and for the encouragement! Problem is that I have exercised during 2nd and 3rd trimester. I was setting a goal for 10 miles of cardio a week. Some weeks were better than others but I've been trying! I wasnt over weight pre pregnancy? I haven't ate everything in site either and have made healthy food choices fir the most part. However I ate lots of carbs which I think is why I have GD. I ate lots of cereal and fruit! I'm trying to deal with the news but it will take sometime getting used to the shots and checking blood sugar. I know my baby girl is worth every pain I'll endure!

I'm 32 weeks on Friday and just got diagnosed. Has anyone had an ultrasound  make sure baby is normal weight? My doctor said he will a little later. The large shoulders big head caused from GD is frightening! I planned on vaginal birth. Fingers crossed abd I'm saying prayers to the man upstairs!

Yea i get checked every two weeks and i turn 31 weeks tomorrow. Starting next week i go for ultrasound every week to keep checking the measurements. I try not to think about it bc then i stress n it makes my sugar high. Bout im a diabetic pre pregnancy. Good luck im sure u n your little one will b fine

Eating carb isn't the reason you have GD. It cause by hormones secreted by your placenta. Now of course you have to watch carbs. The hardest part for me is fruits! I still eat fruit for snack but I add a bit of cheese or nut to have protein that help slow down sugar increase in blood and keep hunger at bay. I still hate the shot but I don't take 15 min to decide to do it anymore.

It seems to be a big epidemic lately. I was diagnosed  borderline gestational diabetic. I don't have to do the shots. But I do have to check my blood 4 times a dsy. Its irritating. My Dr told me that honestly they lowered the numbers recently so now alot of people fall gestational diabetic.

question: I got diagnosed today. I have to give myself insulin shots and then test blood sugar. I was so upset I cried. The thought of giving myself shots in the stomach while pregnant is terrifying! Does anyone have any words of wisdom?
title: Anyone have gestational diabetes?
